column4: you can give nautilus (GUI) admin permissions by running it from terminal with SUDO. Just be very very careful.
so open terminal and type ~:sudo nautilus
is there a command to revert the permissions once i am finished fixing the file?
Sure, you should be able to change it from nautilus right after you move the file
right click-> properties->permissions

I *think* by the windows page you mean Nautilus, which is the file-manager (windows explorer equivalant) in Ubuntu. I know it can be confusing to learn separate names for seemingly core parts of the OS, but Linux is like that, and if you remember them and use them, a side benefit is that we can help you much easier, and moreover, you can search for answers to your questions on google much easier ;)
